DataElement.preferredName: Patient Correlative Study Blood Specimen Consent Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a yes/no question related to the patient's/participant's consent for the use of blood samples for correlative study use.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Correlative Study Blood Specimen Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the patient's/participant's consent for the use of blood samples for correlative study use.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Studies designed to translate basic science findings into clinically useful tools.  Includes marker research.:Blood circulating throughout the body.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: A type of study that tests for a relationship between a condition and a potential causal factor of the condition.

A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.origin: SWOG CRF:Southwest Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Willing to provide blood samples for correlative research purposes

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to 'blood for melphalan PK study' sample collection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to this sample collection?*

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to give extra blood for researchers to study stress proteins?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to having blood sent to COG laboratory and studied to see if genetic and biological changes can be used to predict how a subject will respond to treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to having leftover tissue from diagnosis be sent to a COG laboratory and studied to see if genetic and biological changes can be used to predict how a subject will respond to treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient consented to Pharmacodynamics: Cell-free DNA - Blood Studies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to look for indicators of heart damage to see if genetic changes can be used to predict how a subject will respond to therapy, and for results of heart function tests to be sent to a study researcher?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to the collection of extra blood samples for the biology research studies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was consent given for patient's blood to be sent to a COG laboratory and studied to learn more about the effects of azacitidine treatment, and to help develop future therapies for infants with KMT2A-R ALL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent for blood to be collected and sent to a COG laboratory and studied to see if changes to the immune cells can be used to predict how a subject will respond to therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to having leftover specimen(s) from diagnosis be sent to a COG laboratory and studied to see if genetic and biological changes can be used to predict how a subject will respond to treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: MA39
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has consented to provision of samples of blood in order that the specific correlative marker assays described in the protocol may be conducted.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to submitting blood samples to look for biomarkers that may be used to predict how a person will respond to the therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent so blood may be collected and used for the Down Syndrome and Immune Function study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to the collection of extra blood samples for the biology correlative research studies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient agree to have their blood samples and related health information used for the EAY191-N5 study?

DataElement.origin: SWOG CRF:Southwest Oncology Group Case Report Form
